comment.author: 41338043@N07
comment._content: it's not easy to imagine what these people were thinking when this photo was taken a hundred years ago. they look so severe in their sunday best (i guess).

comment.author: 37217172@N03
comment._content: From left to right: Bergljót Sigurðardóttir (my great grandmother), Soffía Einarsdóttir Sæmundsen (my great great grandmother), Sigurður Gunnarsson (my great great grandfather), and Sigríður María Sigurðardóttir Gunnarsson (my great great aunt) who was called Tanta (from  "tante" which means "aunt" in Danish) and is the only one of these people I ever met. Three brothers and sisters were dead from diphtheria years before this photograph was taken which may explain in part why they are all so solemn. Sigurður was the local pastor and his daughter Bergljót married the dean of the cathedral in Reykjavik (my great grandfather) but died young after having given birth to five children.
